intro: Ptilotus pachocephalus, commonly known as the yellow bush morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in the morning. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are often visited by pollinators such as bees and birds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional Aboriginal medicine.
